ai.summary: Dùn Coillich Blue is a short, easy 3.3 km hike in the UK, suitable for most walkers. The route traverses forest tracks with gentle elevation and quiet woodland scenery, making it a good option for a quick outdoor escape.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail is on well-marked forest paths with mixed surfaces: compact earth and gravel, with occasional muddy patches after rain. Expect gentle climbs, a few small rocky steps, and wet ground in boggy sections; keep to the path to protect wildlife.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast before you go, as UK conditions can change rapidly. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip, bring a waterproof layer, and stay on marked paths. Have a map and compass or a GPS device, carry enough water and snacks, and let someone know your plans. In winter, daylight is limited and paths can be icy; be prepared for reduced visibility and possible fallen branches after storms.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or offline GPS
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish or low light)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (April–October); hikers should be prepared for rain and mud in any season.

seo.title: Dùn Coillich Blue – Easy 3.3 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Dùn Coillich Blue trail, a short and easy 3.3 km hike in the UK. Find terrain details, safety tips, and gear recommendations for a great outdoor experience.
